column1: beats the outside edge as Elgar fishes inside the line of this length ball. It's on an eighth stump line. No swing on that

swing in this time but Elgar handles it deftly. It's late and it's marginal, but he has to get the bat in front of his bat at a middle stump line quickly. He does so with plenty of balance and then gives mid-on a teasing sprint backwards before beating him at the line
another inswinger, but this starts down leg and Elgar leaves
short of a length and pushed across off stump. Left alone
short of a length on off stump, closes the face as he defends into the leg side off the back foot
length on middle stump, brings the bat down late and defends off the inside half on the front foot
short and pushed wide outside off. Left alone
outswinger starts outside leg and hoops towards the stump. But it doesn't do enough. Goes past the pad down leg side
length ball skids low onto the pad. He goes deep in the crease and tickles it to fine leg off the bottom-edge

outside edge carries through to Taylor and Elgar's habit of pushing inside the line has cost him his wicket. Looks like he was defending on the front foot for the one that comes back in, but this holds the line and slants across. He's not played this close to the body and it just carries to the keeper
short of a length on leg stump, tapped into the midwicket region off the back foot
full ball down leg side, left alone
length ball onto leg stump. Dropped behind square leg with soft hands
full and wide outside off. Left alone
length on off stump, defended solidly off the back foot

through him! Jarvis lands one on a length at off stump and it just doesn't climb as Hendricks looks to defend with half a stride forward. It skids from the bottom edge and tonks off stump. South Africa have an early battle.
short and wide outside off, some shape away. Left alone
length and just outside off. Some clib off the surface this time. Defends with soft hands into the covers
full and just outside off stump. Defended to mid-off on the front foot
jumps up at Klaasen as he gets forward. Angles in and thumps him on the thigh guard as he looks to close the face on it
length on off stump, defended off the front foot
shot. Peak Markram. Quickly onto the back foot after an initial forward movement. Gets on top of it nicely and punches it firmly into the turf in front of point. No chance for the fielder
short of a length outside off, left alone
length ball angled into off stump, defended off the back foot
length ball with some late shape away. Watches it closely and runs it down to third man
full ball outside off, blocked on the front foot
short ball in the corridor. A mistimed chop to point
another one jumps from a length. Not easy to gauge this pitch so far. He's forced to get on his toes to defend this
keeps low from a similar length this time. It's on an off stump and Markram has to reach downwards to get an inside edge on this to protect his stumps

nicely done. So important to make use of the bad balls during difficult batting periods. Markram doesn't miss out on this full ball on the pads. Allows it to come on and rolls the wrists to get the flick behind square leg
length on middle stump, thuds his thigh guard as he looks to defend
length and just outside off, solidly behind the line to defend this
length ball in the corridor. Looks to defend into the off side but this angles in and takes the inside edge. Trickles into the leg side
short of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot
short of a length in the corridor, behind the line to dead-bat this
length on leg stump, clipped through square off the inside half of the bat
short outside off. Gets on top of this to try and cut in front of square. But he finds cover
nicely done. Top class. Another short ball outside off and this time he goes with a straighter bat and a higher elbow. Punches between point and cover this time
in the air but well short of the bowler. Pushes with hard hands at a steep ball from a length outside off
length just outside off, defended off the back foot
length outside off, mistimed punch to extra cover's right and they steal the single as that fielder fumbles
length ball jagging in at middle stump. Looks to flick but cops this on the glove
short and wide outside off, cut firmly off the back foot but straight to point
full and in at off stump, blocked solidly on the front foot
short of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot
short of a length on middle stump, tucked to midwicket on the up
full on off stump, tapped to mid-off off the toe end
length and in at leg stump. Defended to mid-on off the front foot

finds midwicket! Klaasen picks the wrong ball to play a release shot. It's not there for the pull - just a tad too full. It's a strangely angled bat as a result. The ball has slanted in as well as he looks to go off the front foot. It's off the inside half and Mire lunges to his right and holds on
beaten. That's...slow-mo vicious. Hoops in, pitches on off and zips past the outside edge. An anxious poke in front of the body from Zondo
length ball outside off. Defended off the inside edge
overpitched outside off, leans into this for the drive but gets it off the toe-end
length on leg stump, clipped to midwicket's left from deep in the crease
length ball slanted into the corridor. Looks to punch on the up but another one comes off the bottom end of the bat

glorious. He can't afford to punch at incoming balls on this pitch, so it has to be all timing. And he times to perfection. Length ball at middle stump, leans in and offers the full face to get this wide of mid-on
short of a length on leg stump, whipped to fine leg off the back foot
full on off stump, blocked on the front foot
beaten. Nicely bowled. Another one that zips away late after angling in. Pushes away from the body at this
length outside off, left alone
short and very wide outside off. Stands tall and slaps it between cover and extra cover
superb. What a talent this guy is. Full ball outside off, late swing on it but he's in great position as it lands and drills it to the cover fence
outside edge but down to third man. Not in control at all this time. Length ball wide outside off and he chucks his hands at this. Thick edge
short and wide outside off, caresses a cut to point
short of a length and in at middle stump. Can't get bat on this flick. It deflects towards third man off the thigh guard

can't hit the stumps! Markram was halfway down the pitch as cover put this throw in at the striker's end. Terrible running from South Africa. Zondo gets a nice connection on this back foot punch and as a result, it bounces nicely to cover. So his call for yes is a bad one. Markram doesn't intervene and goes along. Poor stuff, but they've got away with it.
length on off stump, defended into the off side
length ball keeps low as he looks to defend on the front foot. Manages to keep it out
length just outside off, defended solidly into the covers
length just outside off, clipped to mid-on off the back foot
length ball outside off, punches again to cover's right and says yes immediately. Markram more watchful this time. Cover dives to his right and tips it wide
short of a length in the corridor, runs it to third man's left
short of a length on off stump, dropped into the off side with soft hands
short ball coming in from outside off. Mistimed punch into the covers off the inside half
full on middle stump, tapped to mid-on off the toe-end
length ball into the corridor. Opens the face and runs this to point
short of a length on leg stump, flicked to square leg off the back foot
full ball outside off, jammed to short third man off the thick outside edge
length outside off, blocked on the front foot to short third man's left. Some spin on that one
short of a length on leg stump, tapped through square leg off the back foot
length on leg stump, defended off the back foot
length on off stump, pushed to short third with the turn
length outside off, opens the face and punches to point on the up
skids low and rolls through to the keeper. It's an offcutter, full outside off. Spins past his inside edge as he looks to drill this through cover
length on middle stump, clipped in front of deep square off the inside half

got him! Tiripano has done it. Markram doesn't last long after surviving the run-out chance. It's a short and wide ball outside off and he's looked to whack the leather off it. But it looks like that has extra climb on it and he's not able to adjust for that. Big edge to Taylor's right
full on off stump, driven to mid-off
length ball in at leg stump, blocked on the front foot
inside edge as he looks to drive through cover. Zondo doesn't get close to the ball and there's big gap. Lucky that this rolls past leg stump
beaten as he hoicks across the line with a slog sweep. It's a length ball spinning away from off stump
full toss outside off, driven on the bounce to extra cover's left
length outside off, looks to sweep and gets it off the inside half of the bat. Quick outfield gets him a boundary. This was turning away and he had to fetch it
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
yorker on off stump, jammed back down the pitch. He'd opened his stance for that ball
length on leg stump, clipped to square leg off the front foot
full on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length ball slanting in at off stump. Blocked on the front foot
full on off stump, punched back down the pitch
offcutter at a length outside off, tapped into the covers
short of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot
googly nearly goes through He didn't pick it, turning in from the stumps and wanted to cut, but managed to get some bat on it to keep it out
comes down the track and tops it to long-off
tossed up outside off, and he drives it with a horizontal bat to mid-off
tossed up again, more room outside off, which allows him to slap it away to the man at the cover fence
spotted him coming down the track and shortened his length, he defends it back
gets hold of that too full and given air, Zondo goes down on one knee and sweeps it to the midwicket fence. Went in the air, but it was safe, with no fielder there
length ball on off, defended off the back foot
length outside off, he tries to give himself room to cut. But that didn't bounce enough. Didn't keep low like the one that got Hendricks though
driven straight back takes a few steps down the track to convert it into a half-volley that is drilled back past the bowler
in the air, but safe didn't get hold of the pull, but got enough on it to clear the in-field and the ball fell safely before the midwicket boundary
gets a hold of that alright! One step forward, and he swings the bat to lift this over long-on. The ball was angled into him, he hit it with the angle almost

lucky This is certainly an eventful over. Tries to go big again, but only gets an inside edge that touches the fingertips of Brendan Taylor's gloves, diving to his left behind the stumps, and trickles away to the fence
full on the stumps, driven back straight to the bowler
tosses it up wider, and has Zondo trying to fetch it from outside off to sweep, but misses
gets his line wrong that time. Googly on the stumps, turning away, and wide
comes forward, but the length is a bit shorter. He can just jab it down to mid-on
full toss into the gap Jonker almost pulled that straight to the fielder at deep square leg, but managed to get it in the gap and into the fence
this is a fast outfield. He strayed down leg and he tried to tickle it fine. Didn't make great contact but it runs away to the fine leg fence
through him Jonker was living by the sword, he dies by it. Tossed up and drifting in to pitch on leg stump, straightens enough to beat an almighty swing and break the stumps
punched through extra cover
full on the stumps, and driven back to the bowler
length ball, stump to stump, Duminy defends into the leg-side with an angled bat
back of a length, angling across the left-hander from over the stumps, Duminy defends it on the off-side
length ball on off-stump, and Duminy pats it back
goes fuller on off, and Duminy comes forward to drive, but straight to extra cover
goes for the slog-sweep, trying to fetch it from outside off again, but misses
gets hold of that too short, on leg stump and turning in, Zondo rocks back and pulls it over square leg
takes a half-step forward and checks his drive to hit to cover

the bowler has the last laugh he may have been hit for four, but he kept giving it air, and got Zondo stretching forward. It was outside off again, and drew the batsman enough forward to drag his foot outside the crease, with the 'keeper quick to whip off the bails
flatter outside the left-hander's offstump. He slap-punches it off the back foot to cover
goes too far down leg that time and will be wided
flatter on the stumps, turned to short midwicket
length ball outside off, defended to cover
goes a bit wider to angle it across the batsman, but it ends up on the stumps, and is driven back
angles it across again, and this time he steers it down to third man for a single
full and on the stumps, squirts it off the outside edge to deep point
angled across, and he lets it go outside off
length ball, gets it to straighten a touch, and it's defended back
length ball on the stumps, he goes on the back foot and punches it back to the bowler
past the outside edge googly that didn't turn much, but beat his defensive prod to just miss the outside edge
yes no.. but safe turned away to square leg, he didn't want the run initially, but was called through and responded eventually. No real danger, and the run was always on
full on the stumps, driven back to the bowler
comes forward  to drive to long on
length ball on off, defended to point
back of a length but that didn't bounce too high. He gets inside the line to swivel-pull it down to fine leg
goes for the big drive to this one, full on off, but plays and misses
full on the stumps, tries to clip it through midwicket, but gets a leading edge that rolls to mid-off
length ball, angling across and he watches it go through to the keeper
gets it to bounce a tad uncomfortably from a length to near chest height, but the batsman is able to keep it down
full and on off-stump, driven to mid-off
full outside off, defended into the offside
length ball on the stumps, steered to point
comes down the track to clip this to midwicket
length ball on the stumps, slight turn. He goes on the backfoot to punch it past the bowler and to long-on
wider outside off, and he can cut it past the in-field to the man on the point fence

big shout and given slanted across, but pitched in line and came back in a touch. Just enough to beat the bat, and not enough to be missing the stumps. That looked out in real-time. The move to bring back Jarvis has worked immediately
length ball outside off, he shoulders arms
beaten length ball on the stumps and straightens a bit to beat Steyn's poke and goes over the stumps
fuller on the stumps, he comes on the front foot and drives, but with no timing.. The ball rolls to mid-on
full outside off, he times the drive better that time, but straight to mid-off
wicket maiden length ball on the stumps, and he bunts it back
on the pads, tried to flick it away but doesn't get hold of it
stays on the pads, he goes back to turn this to the left of midwicket
past the outside edge some turn for Williams from off stump and beats Steyn's airy drive
comes forward to defend
tossed up on the stumps and Steyn defends off the front foot
quicker on the stumps, Steyn is a bit late in defending it, takes the inside edge and rolls to square leg
back of a length on leg stump, he tries to slap it into the legside but doesn't get hold of it. Bottom edge goes to square leg
length ball outside off, defended a bit tentatively to point
short ball Steyn is able to duck harmlessly under it. Dug in but outside off
length ball on the stumps, hint of moving in. Steyn pats it back to mid-on
off the outside edge Steyn threw his bat at it, as the bowler perhaps meant him to. Full ball but wide of offstump, and he gets a thick edge through where second slip would have been
shuffles across the stumps and punches it to the left of mid-on
comes down the track to hit it, but gets an inside edge that goes through midwicket
length on the pads, he goes back to clip it to deep square leg
strays down leg, and it clips Steyn's pads to roll to fine leg
goes back to turn it away but hits straight to midwicket
goes back and clips it to midwicket's left that time
full on the stumps, he flicks it away to deep midwicket
tossed up full on off, and patted back to the bowler
quicker on leg and turning, he clips it to midwicket
tossed up, ends up as a full toss, Steyn turns it to midwicket
drags it down short, allowing him to rock back and pull it to deep midwicket
fuller on off, punches it but straight back
beaten googly outside off, doesn't turn much but enough to defeat his big swing and go through to the 'keeper
full on the stumps, he comes forward to defend
thick edge, but safe looped up outside off, and Steyn wanted to slog-sweep but it goes off the outside edge and over slip
flatter on the stumps, bunted down to long-off
strays down leg and will be wided. The batsman shaped to pull which unsighted Taylor behind the stumps and it rolls off his thigh pad to let them run one too
goes back and turns it to midwicket
big shout turning from legstump and he goes down for a big slog-sweep but doesn't connect. Perhaps that pitched outside the line. or if it didn't, might have turned past off stump
rocks back to pull the shorter one, but great work by the man at the square leg fence keeps them down to one
full on the stumps, and clipped to long-on
full on off stump, defended carefully
full toss and allows Steyn to smack it to the deep midwicket fence with a powerful swipe
quicker one on the stumps, he cuts it to point
full on the stumps, floats a bit. Steyn defends
too full, on the pads, and he turns it away to midwicket
slog-sweeps across the line down on one knee to midwicket
stays back and plays it late, whips it to square-leg's left
takes the attack to the bowler goes down the ground and hits it straight back past the bowler, that rockets into the fence
beaten on the slog sweep again. Goes down on one knee, but the ball straightened past his bat. Another shout for lbw
stays back to cut to point's left
defended back to mid-on
short of a length just outside off, punched to mid-on off the back foot
full outside off, sliced to extra cover on the up
short of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover
just clears mid-on with a pull. He was looking to smash this a long way and ended up slicing from under it. Short ball rising up at his ribs
bouncer in the corridor, ducks to let it go
length outside off, shuffles into the off side and taps it back to the bowler
length on middle stump, steps out and drives to long-on
full and wide outside off, driven to mid-off with the turn
length ball angled in at leg stump, gets deep in the crease and taps to long-on
full on leg stump, clipped to deep midwicket
short of a length on leg stump, glanced to short fine off the back foot
full on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length just outside off, punched back towards the bowler
length ball wide outside off, slaps it off the front foot but finds extra cover
short ball at the hips, dropped into the square leg region off the back foot
slower ball dropped at a length outside off, gets deep in the crease and whips to midwicket
short ball wide outside off. Looks for the pull past mid-on, gets it back to the bowler off the toe-end
short ball just outside off, dropped into the leg side off the back foot
length on middle, punched to long-on off the back foot
full on leg stump, flicked to short fine
shot. Full ball outside off, puts in only half a stride and taps it with the turn, on the up and once he gets it past mid-off, this blazes away to the boundary
short of a length on middle stump, whipped to deep midwicket
clears the boundary. Length ball lands outside leg stump from around the wicket, Andile jumps down to meet it at the pitch and drills it flat over long-on
short of a length on leg stump, flicked to deep square off the back foot
dropped short outside off, chopped to sweeper cover
length ball down leg side, can't get bat on the flick
full on leg stump, defended down the pitch
full ball outside off, angled-bat drive onto boot, off the inside edge
quicker ball fired down leg side, and he lets it go
wide of long-on with the pull. Drops this short on middle stump, he gets back in the crease and pummels this into the empty region there
slider at a length on off, gets it off the inside edge as he looks to block on the front foot
full on leg stump, tapped straight to midwicket
shot! This is classy from Steyn. Length ball on off with only the angle into him serving a leg side shot. And he uses that to flick his wrists at this and get it wide of mid-on, on the up
length ball wide outside off, chucks his hands at it and it's a big outside edge over slip. This is his highest score in ODIs
short of a length on middle stump, tapped to midwicket off the back foot

smash. Chatara was the one fans hoped would break this partnership, but Steyn has decided he's the one to go after. This is length on middle, he clears the front leg and heaves it - with no grace - to the midwicket boundary
short of a length outside off, drags it to mid-on with a mistimed pull
short of a length just outside off, punched to sweeper cover off the back foot
full on leg stump, a quicker one. Pings off the inside edge to short fine as he looks to defend
length ball down leg side, can't get bat on the flick
length ball skidding through at off stump, hurriedly punched into the leg side
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
full on off stump, sliced to point off the front foot
short of a length outside off, nudged back to the bowler off the back foot
top edge off a really high full toss. He's tried to pull it and it's above waist. Can't control the shot but it lands safely, somwwhere behind the the non-striker. Free hit coming up
googly tossed up wide outside off. Looks to go hard at this with a slog sweep, but gets it off the toe to short third man
length ball wide outside off, big swing at it but no connection
offcutter at a length outside off, jabs at it but is beaten on the outside edge
short of a length outside off, backs away and guides to third man

given caught behind and Phehlukwayo is not happy about this. It's a length ball down leg side. He's looked to flick and there's a sound as this goes past the stumps and to Taylor. Looks like the batsman is annoyed with himself, because replays show no evidence of pad on that and there's a woody sound. He's done so well and it must sting to be caught down leg side
length ball in at off stump, defended into the covers
short and wide outside off, won't chase that one, the now-specialist-batsman-with-tons-of-composure
floated up full on leg stump, jammed down the pitch
full on off stump, blocked on the front foot

trapped in front and he's gone. Another full, slow ball on middle stump. Tahir looking to dead-bat this has gone through it too early - his bat is blocked by his boot as a result. Much before the ball has arrived and hit him in front of middle
length ball pushed through flat at leg stump, tapped to mid-on off the front foot
lovely! What a shot! Mid-on is in so Ngidi must go over him. It's elementary. Tossed up outside off, uses his big reach to get to this and lofts it sweetly over that fielder
length on leg stump, defended into the off side
bouncer in the corridor. Makes Steyn jump out of the way of that
short of a length on leg stump, tickled to fine leg's right and a quick call to steal the second
short of a length just outside off, defended off the back foot

beaten. Undoes all the poise of last ball that made him look a top-order batsman by scampering into the leg side as this ball comes at him. Looking to make room for the single at third man, but he can't get bat on it
slower ball, short of a length outside off. Backs away and swipes at it. Can't connect
length on middle stump, falls away into the leg side again and squeezes this through cover with an open face
short of a length on leg stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
full on off stump, pushed down the pitch off the front foot
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
dropped. A tough chance for Williams to his right. Ngidi chips it back as he goes with hard hands on the forward defence. Williams dives one-handed to the right but can't hold on
length on off, defended on the front foot
length on leg stump, defended into the midwicket region
length on off stump, slogs and gets this to long-on off the inside half
bouncer flies past Ngidi's helmet and he tells Jarvis immediately that he will get some of the same when Ngidi has the ball
short of a length in the corridor, jumps up and it hits him on the glove as he looks to defend off the back foot
short of a length in the corridor, shapes to duck but realises this is fuller than he expects. Swishes at it and is beaten

another nasty bouncer in the corridor and Ngdii has no clue about it either. Another bit of banter between the batsman and bowler. Bowler with a big smile right now, might not have one if he gets to bat today
length ball wide outside off, left alone
short ball outside off, toe-ended punch to mid-off
short ball wide outside off, pulls it to long-on's left
beaten. Offcutter lobbed up at a length, wide outside off. Looks to smoke it over midwicket with front leg well outside leg stump. But he's deceived by the pace
bouncer at an off stump line and he ducks under this

beautiful chip over the bowler and that is his maiden fifty! What a time to get it. Full ball on the stumps, stands tall and launches if cleanly. He's now the fourth South African after Klusener, Andrew Hall and Richard Snell to get a fifty at No. 9
length on leg stump, clipped neatly to deep square leg
length ball pushed through at leg stump. Defended off the back foot
short of a length outside off, punched on the up to mid-off
full outside off, toe-ended drive to mid-off
length on off stump, defended to cover off the front foot
length on leg stump, punched to long-on on the up
tossed up at middle stump, a sweetly timed drive to long-on that won't get him any runs

misfield at deep midwicket and Steyn's aesthetically pleasing gully-cricket hoick is rewarded. He steps out and heaves at the length ball and seems to have smashed it, but it's come off the toe-end. The fielder runs in and it lands short of him and spins away
top edge falls short of third man. Another slower ball, dropped short of a length outside off. Swipes across the line
misses a full toss and loses middle stump. South Africa fall short of 200. He's looked to heave this but completely misses
on the money straight away, getting a bit of shape away from the batsman. He runs it down to third man off a thickish outside edge
fuller on the stumps, and defended
straight back there's still some movement in the air but he goes too full, allowing the batsman to punch it back with sweet timing
straight but too full, allows him to dig it away to mid-on's right
past the edge on a length and rising up, it holds its line. He plays inside it and ball whistles past
tucks it to midwicket off the backfoot. They think about a run but wisely decide against it
in the air he tried to flick it, was a bit early into the shot and it flew to short midwicket's left. And then it teased the fielder, but beat him to the boundary
back of a length outside off and good bounce. He lets it go through
rapped on the gloves came back in from a length, he was looking to leave it, but the ball bounced more than he thought and rapped him on the gloves
Steyn's on fire length ball on the stumps, it comes back in off the seam a touch and raps him on the back pad. Straightforward decision for the umpire, that looked plumb
hello, bounce and pace! that hit a crack back of a length and just rears up. He was lifting his arms to shoulder them, and it bounced up to hit his gloves near shoulder height
nasty He was going forward to that, and it took off from a length to hit his grille!
and now it goes through at the height of the pads from the same length - just outside off. It's no wonder Ervine can't get bat on it
inside edge almost chopped on. Tentatively played at this length ball outside off, and got the under edge that rolled towards fine leg
goes slightly fuller on the stumps. Driven off the bottom of the bat to mid-on
length ball, angling across him, comes forward to defend, the ball rolls away to square leg off the inside edge
angling across again, fuller on off and he defends off the front foot
length on off angled across again, he comes forward to drive. Straight to cover
too full, and the batsman drives, but with a checked shot. Mid-on has to tumble to stop the ball
length ball outside off, he comes forward to defend
fuller on off, he defends again but the ball takes the inside edge to go towards square leg

this is getting into dangerous territory Steyn is hitting the length from where balls are taking off, hitting the cracks. This one rises up from back of a length to the batsman's face. He just about fends it off
length ball on off, defended to mid-off
short ball, and this one rises above the batsman too. But that was fine, because it was dug in short
the pitch has made footwork indecisive. He comes half forward to a length ball, but this one doesn't take off, allowing him to steer it to third man at the last moment
dug in short again, and he ducks underneath this one too harmlessly
fuller length on off, defended towards point
good looking punch. Fuller ball on off, he comes forward and gets it into the gap, to cover's right
defended tentatively towards mid-on. It was almost as if he expected that to bounce up off a length, but it stayed normal
length ball on off, coming back into him and he defends it solidly
draws the edge bounces from back of a length - not like Steyn's were doing, but enough to fly off the outside edge to third man
angling across and he lets it go through to the keeper
back of a length again, but it doesn't rise alarmingly, allowing him to bunt it into the offside for a quick single
back of a length on off, he rises up and defends it down
another brute back of a length on the stumps and it goes near the shoulder and throat area again. Fended down
goes very full then, and the batsman's hanging a bit on the back foot understandably, manages to dig it out towards mid-off
top edge six dug it short, but not very short. It still bounced a bit more than he expected, and his intended pull shot only resulted in a top edge. But it flew all the way over the keeper for six
length ball outside off, patted towards cover
back of a length on off, defended back
goes a bit fuller then, and the batsman pats it back tentatively
full and outside off, he lets it go through to the keeper
beaten back of a length and he wanted to punch through the off, but it bounced more than he thought, going past the bat
lets it go through outside off
maiden this one keeps very low. Outside off and a bit on the fuller side, he went for the drive but the ball scooted through to the keeper
keeps it on a length outside off, the batsman is up on his toes but the ball goes under the bat
back of a length outside off, and he was hanging back waiting for the one that bounces more. Runs it down to third man from chest high
that kept low barely goes till the kneeroll, from the same sort of length that Steyn got balls to whiz past the head. This one is kept out at the last moment from the stumps
opened the face of the bat to steer it, but straight to gully, at one bounce.
back of a length and on the stumps, defended to cover

Phehlukwayo plucks it out of the air Steyn has two wickets now to go with his 60. Dug this in short, and he tried to pull it, but the fielder at short midwicket flies to his right to hold on with both hands. That came off the toe-end of the bat
fuller length outside off, defended to cover
defended to point off the back foot
fuller on the stumps, driven gently to mid-on. Loud, early call of 'NO'
keeps it very straight, and he flicks it off his pads, but straight to midwicket
misfielded at cover point back of a length on off, he stands tall to punch. Khaya Zondo lets it go through
back of a length, defended
length ball outside off, he lets it go through
another one rears up on off, hit a crack and spat up, taking the top of the bat's handle and flying up over the slips
that's not a ball you want to get after one that has almost taken your head off. length outside off, pacy and beats his outside edge. It was a tentative poke
and that keeps low on the stumps, length but he keeps it out, bringing his bat down at the last moment
strays down the pads, and he is able to turn it away to fine leg
loud shout off-cutter that hit him on the knee roll. That looked dead, but the ball bounced up off the knee roll and into his chest, perhaps fooled hte umpire into thinking it had hit him very high
comes half forward to defend
strays down the pads, he is unable to get bat on it. It rolls down to fine leg
full on the stumps, defended back to the bowler
very straight, fuller length, and he is able to clip it towards mid-on for a quick single
coming in slightly from a length on off, it takes a thick inside edge and rolls to square leg
length ball on off, tried to drive and got an inside edge to midwicket
outside edge goes to drive, but it takes the edge of the bat and flies through where gully would have been

mix up, but no direct hit it kept a bit low, he opened the face of the bat to run it to point. Wanted the single but there was a bit of yes-no. Zondo ran in but had only one stump to aim, at the batsman's end and missed. Masakadza was well away from making it but he's safe
another edge through gully goes for the drive, gets the edge again and it runs away through gully again
length outside off and this keeps low again
comes back into him and he is able to tuck it towards square leg
full on the stumps, turned to short midwicket
full and on the stumps again, he wrists it to long-on
googlybeats his forward defensive prod, to take the inside edge towards square leg
strays down leg, allowing him to sweep it fine for much-needed runs
the googly gets him he didn't read it, and it beats his forward defensive shot and cannons into the pad. Tahir appeals and almost takes off on his run while still appealing
good length on the stumps, and defended solidly
got 'im he's caught on the crease, It comes in with the angle, perhaps off the seam too, and beats him. The variable bounce has probably contributed to him not coming forward or going back decisively
Beaten. No foot movement and tries to drive
strays on the pads, but he's unable to get bat on it. the balls rolls to fine-leg
angling across and beats the outside edge, with the batsman poking away from his body
full on off stump and driven, but straight to mid-off
googly beats his forward prod and goes through the gap, just past off stump
wide down leg
punched to point
googly again, big turn and he didn't read it. inside edged on to pad
another googly, defended from the stumps
full ball, comes forward to drive it to long-off
length ball on off stump, blocked on the front foot
short of a length and just outside off. Looks to chop this down to third man but gully leaps to the left and stops this
length on off stump, looks to jab through the cover, but it drops into the off side off the bat-pad
yorker at off stump, jammed towards mid-off
sweetly struck. This is full and in at off stump. He skips into the leg side and drills this between bowler and mid-off
and another. Creates room for himself and brings down the full face of the bat to punch this full ball past the bowler
full on off stump, met on the full and drive to long-off
googly at a length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
googly at a length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
short of a length on middle stump, punched to long-on off the back foot

appeal for stumping as Tahir rips a googly past Williams' outside edge. Klaasen looks confident. And it appears the base of WIlliams' foot has lifted and the toe isn't behind the line...that's out. Quick work from Klaasen after Tahir completely flummoxes the batsman after drawing him forward.
short of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
short of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
short of a length outside off, stretches out and jabs to get it down to third man off the thick outside edge
length on off stump, defended off the back foot

straight to second slip! This is falling apart quickly for Zimbabwe. Chigumbura is their last specialist batsman. He's looked to get a single at third man but his late cut is a lazy waft in the end and he has guided a simple catch for Hendricks. It was a short of a length ball with not enough room outside off for the cut
bouncer at an off stump line

that's plumb. Moor doesn't put in any sort of a stride against this full ball. It's a slider on leg stump. He's playing an off stump line. It's very soft and very meek - it's an embodiment of this chase. Tahir is on a hat-trick.

hat-trick! Tahir has burst through Mavuta's defence with a googly and tonked his off stump. Fourth South African to do it after Langeveldt, Duminy and Rabada. It was on a length, it drew the batsman forward, and it was too good for him.
googly, at a length outside off. Jabs at it with hard hands and gets an inside edge through square leg
slider at a length down leg side, pings off the keeper's pad and trickles towards the fine leg boundary
short of a length just outside off, hurriedly cut through point

bowled him! Jarvis with a heave across the line and he's lost leg stump. Among other things. It's another googly, at a length. Lobbed up slow, front leg out of the way. Misses. Just as well - the fast bowlers were waiting to have a go at Jarvis next over, no doubt. Tahir gets his third five-wicket haul in ODIs.
googly, full and very wide outside off. Reaches out and opens the face to run this to short third man
length ball just outside off, slanting in. He gets forward to defend and gets an inside edge onto front pad. Lbw appeal is turned down
length just outside off, defended into the gully area off the back foot
hits the bat even as he tries to leave this. Length ball in the channel and he can't get the bat out of the way quickly enough. It trickles past the stumps
short of a length outside off, sliced to third man's right
length ball at leg stump, dropped into the leg side with soft hands
short ball in the corridor, sliced to third man off the back foot
googly at a length on leg stump. Gets forward to defend and this flies off the inside edge to the fine leg boundary
big appeal for lbw but this googly might be sliding down leg. Gets well forward and is trapped in front of leg stump on the defence
googly, short of a length and in at off stump. Backs away and jabs it into the off side
beats the outside edge and off stump. A slider, too quick for the batsman who is going back to try and cut this
dropped short and very wide. He cuts aerially but this is safely wide of short third man
floated up at a length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
runs the hell away from strike. Chatara backs away and jabs a length ball into the off side. Says yes and looks one way.
short ball on leg stump, lifts up at him as he tries to get out of the way. Pings off the elbow guard and clears the wicketkeeper
wants to run again but this time Steyn is at the ball and doesn't let him. Length ball on off stump, tries to drop it into the covers
gets away from strike! Length ball on leg stump, backs away and stabs it through midwicket
length on middle stump, defended into the leg side
short of a length on leg stump, defended off the back foot
length ball on off stump, blocked on the front foot
googly, looped up at a length outside off. Jumps up at his body as he looks to block on the front foot
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length ball outside off, past the outside edge as he looks to defend
googly at a length outside off, blocked on the front foot

picks the one fielder out on the leg side! It's a slider dropped short on middle stump. He gets good bat on this but he manages to hit this short-arm pull straight to deep midwicket. That is six for Tahir and a 120-run win for South Africa.
